Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of Ebola mutations by suggesting that every time somebody new gets the virus, it mutates.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that not every mutation of the Ebola virus makes it more deadly or difficult to treat.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that every time somebody new gets the Ebola virus, it mutates.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that every mutation of the Ebola virus has a significant impact on its behavior inside the human body, which may not be true.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that the Ebola virus mutates inside its host, even if it is never passed on to another person.
